newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: ASIAN EXOTICS - Rupiah weakness plagues regionals.
newsitem.headline: ASIAN EXOTICS - Rupiah weakness plagues regionals.

text.p: 0330 GMT - Indonesian rupiah hits new lows against dollar, triggering fresh sales of other Southeast Asian currencies.
* Funds continue to sell rupiah heavily after Bank Indonesia move on Thursday to end system of managing exchange rates through intervention band.
* Rupiah hits low of 2,890 to dollar as overnight rates drop back to 30 percent from record high of 125 percent. Moves exaggerated by wide spreads.
* Singapore dollar hits 37-month low of 1,5220 to U.S. dollar on spillover selling. Talk of central bank intervention near low spurs slight recovery.
* Malaysian ringgit remains under pressure from strong dollar bids by U.S. funds amid volatility in region.
* Ringgit quoted at 2.7890/7920 to dollar against 2.7650/700 late Thursday. Seen testing 2.80 low, but some support expected at 2.7950.
* Thai baht eases on continued commercial demand for dollar. Market eyes impending announcement of cabinet reshuffle, but it seen having little impact on baht.
* Philippine peso weakens further to 29.72/82 against previous close at 29.49. Seen testing record low of 30, but 29.85 expected to provide support.
* Central bank continues to offer dollars at 10 centavos above best market offer.
* Taiwan dollar edges lower on strong demand for U.S. dollar from importers. Central bank sales of U.S. dollar at T$28.727 stem decline.
